alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Candler (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:48PM EDT until May 24 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF BULLOCH AND CANDLER COUNTIES... At 548 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Denmark to 6 miles south of Register, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: Statesboro, Metter, Brooklet, Portal, Pulaski, Register, Nevils, Aline, Georgia Southern, Hopeulikit and Denmark. This warning includes I-16 between mile markers 99 and 126. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
